txt.en: The slaves of Carn Dûm were set free, but Éa, a woman of the hillmen dwelling at Tármunn Súrsa, is still missing her husband.
'Be careful not to get too close!'

'My husband remains in Carn Dûm. I know you have already done so much, but please... find it in your heart to help me once more.

'Erscin is strong of back and force of will. I cannot imagine that he fell to the Orcs, though perhaps he tried to escape and was killed. I cannot bear to imagine such things.

'If he lives, I fear he will not live long. I am sure that the Evil Ones will punish any slaves that remained behind. You must return to Carn Dûm and find him!'
Carn Dûm lies far to the west of Tármunn Súrsa.\n\nÉa begged you to find her missing husband, the hillman-warrior called Erscin.
'Thank you, [placeholder], for rescuing me. I must return now to my wife. She will be worried that I have left her.\n\n'You may continue on. I know the way from here. Be well, friend.'
Erscin is at Carn Dûm, far to the west of Gath Forthnír.\n\nErscin is waiting to speak with you again.
Éa is at Tármunn Súrsa, east of Carn Dûm.\n\nYou found Erscin, alive and well, within Carn Dûm and returned him to safety. You should let Éa know the good tidings.
'Please, return to Carn Dûm and find Erscin!'
'My dear husband has returned to me! Thank you, Southron, for all you have done!'
'Thank you, stranger. Whoever you are, I can see that you are no Orc-friend. Let us depart this evil place. And please, whatever you do, do not awaken the gorthorog!'
'I thought I was doomed for sure!  Thank you!'
'They will bring others!  Don't wake them!'
